articles.title: RBCK Spokesman Denounces Reckless Act of Hangichong
articles.content:
RBCK Spokesman Denounces Reckless Act of Hangichong
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Religious Believers Council of Korea (RBCK) Thursday made public a statement denouncing the General Association of Christians of south Korea (Hangichong) for mulling building the Aegibong Light Tower to be higher than the removed one and setting up make-shift facilities to hold a "lighting ceremony" on Christmas this year. 
					 This is an intolerable insult to the religious men in the north and a mockery of them and challenge to the public at home and abroad as it is an unpardonable act of dancing to the tune of the south Korean puppet authorities who abuse sacred religion for confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Whoever desirous of national reconciliation, unity, peace and security should not join in the frantic confrontation moves of the U.S. and south Korean authorities but categorically reject them.
					
					 Hangichong is zealously dancing to the tune of the regime as its servant in the anti-DPRK psychological warfare which will fan up the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and bring a war disaster. This only self-exposes that Hangichong is a phony religious body kowtowing to the regime, indifferent to the north-south relations and the destiny of the nation.
					
					 Hangichong must stop its shameful act of joining in the above-despicable psychological warfare of the regime and halt at once the building of the Aegibong Light Tower and cancel the above-said ceremony.
					
					 If it presses ahead with the building of the light tower and the ceremony at any cost in defiance of strong opposition of all Koreans in the north and the south and overseas, it will be held wholly responsible for the ensuing consequences.
					
					 All religious bodies and religionists in south Korea should decisively check and frustrate the above-said moves which will escalate the confrontation and bring only disaster to the nation.

articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman's Statement Distributed as UNGA and UNSC Official Document
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman's Statement Distributed as UNGA and UNSC Official Document
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Nov. 20 statement of a spokesman of the DPRK Foreign Ministry was distributed as official document A/69/616-S/2014/849 of the UN General Assembly and the UN Security Council on Dec. 2.
					 The statement was issued by the DPRK Foreign Ministry in connection with the fact that the U.S. rammed the anti-DPRK "human rights resolution" through the Third Committee of the 69th UN General Assembly through some EU member countries and Japan and high-handed practices and political and economic pressure.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit DPRK Embassies
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Delegates of a political party and an institution of Myanmar and Nigerian personages visited the DPRK embassies in their countries on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included the delegates of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar and the Medical Research Institute, the chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the director of a Nigerian oil company.
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the full-length paintings depicting them standing together and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The acting secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar praised Kim Jong Il as the great leader who dedicated his whole life to the happiness and prosperity of the Korean people and the global cause of independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said:
					
					 The benevolent politics of love and trust enforced by Kim Jong Il moved all people.
					
					 He successfully applied comradeship to politics and consolidated the single-minded unity of the whole society in every way.
					
					 He made ceaseless field guidance tours throughout the country, always lent an ear to the voices of the people and mapped out the policies and lines by comprehensively dealing with their will and desire.

articles.title: Protection of Disabled Persons in DPRK
articles.content:
Protection of Disabled Persons in DPRK
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Signal achievements have been witnessed in the efforts to improve the living of disabled persons in the DPRK this year.
					 Amendments were made to the implementation regulations of the law on protection of the disabled, according to a Cabinet decision adopted in March, said Kim Mun Chol, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Federation for the Protection of the Disabled, at a meeting to mark the International Day of Persons with Disabilities.
					
					 Noting that the amended regulations are aimed at bettering the living conditions of the disabled, he continued:
					
					 A joint meeting with the disabled persons took place at the Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palace in June to mark the National Day of Persons with Disabilities.
					
					 The federation has conducted a sample survey to estimate the demand of the disabled for health recovery and their participation in social life.
					
					 Teaching schedules for persons with disabilities were worked out, thanks to the universal 12-year compulsory education system. And the 3rd-term course started at the training school for the disabled in May, as part of an effort to intensify professional education for them.
					
					 After-school education in music and dance also began this year.
					
					 A training course for international sign language was given to the deaf and dumb in the DPRK this year, thus enabling them to have understanding with foreigners.
					
					 The persons with disabilities in the DPRK took the third place in the table tennis single and swimming events of the 2014 Para Asian Games. Meanwhile, deaf-and-dumb footballers are scheduled to have a friendly match in Australia.
					
					 The federation has also carried on a wide range of international exchanges and cooperation in this field.

articles.title: Korea Green Fund Emerges in DPRK
articles.content:
Korea Green Fund Emerges in DPRK
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Korea Green Fund was set up in the DPRK on October 30, 2014.
					 The mission of the Fund, headquartered in Kinmaul-dong No.1, Moranbong District of Pyongyang, is to raise the public interest in the green development through loans to those units engaged in the research into green energy, renewable resources, green foods, organic farming method, etc.
					
					 The Fund depends on donations by overseas compatriots, foreigners and domestic institutions, enterprises, organizations and individuals aspiring after the green development.
					
					 It will run its own annual bulletin and website to introduce the results of its activities and show appreciation for exemplary donors by such means as providing tours of scenic spots in the country.
					
					 The Korea Green Fund will work to strengthen the close cooperation with non-governmental organizations and individuals of all other countries and regions.

articles.title: Non-electric Hydraulic Ram Developed
articles.content:
Non-electric Hydraulic Ram Developed
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Heat Engineering Institute under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has recently developed a new type of big hydraulic ram for dry-field irrigation.
					 This non-electric ram is simpler in structure and operation than the existing ones.
					
					 It can be used in any place with over 2-meter head of water.

articles.title: Pungsan Dog, Specialty of Korea
articles.content:
Pungsan Dog, Specialty of Korea
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Pungsan dog is native to the area of Kim Hyong Gwon County (former Pungsan County), Ryanggang Province in the DPRK.
					 It has been famous from long ago for smartness and bravery with high resistance to cold and disease.
					
					 It has a round head with short snout, black or grey eyes and small triangular prick-ears. Its neck is short yet thick and its furry color is white or yellowish white. She-dog has 55-58cm long trunk and he-dog 57-60cm long trunk, weighing approximately 18-24kg.
					
					 It whelps 2-3 puppies or 6 to the maximum in 60-70 days after copulation.
					
					 The Pungsan dog has been beloved as a hound by the Korean people from long ago for its strong fighting spirit and courage.
					
					 Now, thanks to the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea for the protection of national heritage, it was listed as a living monument of the country.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls on Service Personnel and People to Turn out to Create and Protect Woodland
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls on Service Personnel and People to Turn out to Create and Protect Woodland
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- It is the most important work for the whole party and army and all people to turn out in tree-planting and forest protection for successfully implementing the behests of leader Kim Jong Il and the noble intention of respected Marshal Kim Jong Un. Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in an editorial. 
					 Tree-planting and forest protection provide a firm guarantee for consolidating our eternal cradle and achieving the prosperity of the generations to come, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 Now is the time for all people to unhesitatingly buckle down to the work for creating and protecting woodland, regarding it as an important one related to the future of the country and the nation and the final victory in the drive for building a thriving nation. 
					
					 We should turn out as one in the above-said work under the patriotic slogan "Let us turn the country into a thick woodland and greenery!" and make a fresh history of golden mountains in the new century of Juche. 
					
					 Everybody is required to plant even a single tree on this land and take warm care of a forest, whether he or she is appreciated or not, with the  high ideological awareness to have his or her patriotic faith and enthusiasm examined by doing so. 
					
					 It is necessary to fully display the might of cooperation between service personnel and people in the on-going drive for planting trees. 
					
					 A genuine patriot is the man who plants more trees and takes deep care of them. 
					
					 The editorial calls upon all the service personnel and people to turn out as one in the work for turning the country into a thick woodland and greenery with ardent patriotism and convert the country into a thriving socialist nation and a land of bliss for the people.

articles.title: With Nothing Can S. Korean Puppet Forces Tarnish Dignified Image of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
With Nothing Can S. Korean Puppet Forces Tarnish Dignified Image of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The anti-DPRK "human rights" racket kicked up by the south Korean puppet forces is the most vivid manifestation of their criminal "policy toward the north" as it is aimed to do harm to the dignified socialist system in the DPRK and a dangerous action to invent a pretext for igniting a war against it, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces have used the "human rights" issue along with the nuclear issue as a means for doing harm to the north and provoking a war for aggression, while disturbing the nation's reconciliation and unity and escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 In fact, the "human rights" issue in the north much touted by the puppet forces is no more than a product of plots of the U.S. and other hostile forces to tarnish the DPRK's image in the international arena and boost cooperation in the international campaign for pressure upon it.
					
					 It is the supreme principle governing the state activities of the DPRK to serve the people and prioritize the people's dignity and interests.
					
					 Nevertheless, the puppet forces are becoming more desperate in their "human rights" offensive, while shamelessly misrepresenting the reality of the DPRK.
					
					 Their "human rights" racket is nothing but the last-ditch efforts of those who are taken aback by the full play of the advantages and might of the Korean-style socialist system.
					
					 Just as one cannot get the sun eclipsed by one's palms, with neither fabrication nor hypocrisy can they impair the dignified image of the DPRK.

articles.title: Korean Documentary "Persons of Meritorious Service in Era of Songun" (3) Produced
articles.content:
Korean Documentary "Persons of Meritorious Service in Era of Songun" (3) Produced
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Korean documentary "Persons of Meritorious Service in Era of Songun" (3) was produced in the DPRK.
					 The film deals with the noble spiritual world of persons of meritorious service who have performed feats in the drive for achieving the prosperity of the socialist homeland, cherishing Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 Among them are Kang Hye Gyong, lecturer of the Yuphyong Revolutionary Site in Changsong County, North Phyongan Province who remains loyal to the work for managing the revolutionary site with her family, Pak Yon Hwa, agitator of the Sindang Stockbreeding Cooperative Farm in Ichon County, Kangwon Province, whom the Workers' Party of Korea put forward as a model of genuine human beings in the era and Jong Jin Chol, manager of the Rajin Building Repair Office in Rason City, who is taking the lead in the efforts to build well his residential  place and worksite.
					
					 The film also shows the true life and efforts of a management official in a rural village, nurse of a village clinic, ordinary educator and woman researcher who are rendering devoted services at their posts, whether they are known or appreciated or not, having the outlook on life that they would become the roots of the country.

articles.title: Korean in China Assails S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Korean in China Assails S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Chong Su, vice-chairman of the Jilin Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China, on Nov. 25 made public a statement in denunciation of the south Korean puppet group's anti-DPRK "human rights" racket.
					 It said: The criminal anti-DPRK "human rights" resolution was rammed by the U.S. and its followers through the Third Committee of the 69th UN General Assembly. This greatly enraged all the overseas Koreans as it was an intolerable insult and challenge to the sovereignty, social system of the DPRK and its people.
					
					 The south Korean puppet group is working hard to fabricate the "law on human rights in the north" and set up the UN "office on human rights in the north" in south Korea in a bid to turn it into a plot-breeding center for anti-DPRK "human rights" offensive.
					
					 It has staged military provocations and war drills against the compatriots in the north and connived and patronized human scum's leaflet scattering operations in defiance of the DPRK's efforts for mending the inter-Korean relations, pushing these relations to a more dangerous catastrophe.
					
					 Its ulterior intention is to hide the poor human rights record in the south Korean society, tarnish the daily rising prestige of the DPRK and bring down its social system. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet group is stooges serving the U.S. in its "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					
					 It should stop acting rashly, cogitating about the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket, the statement held.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Make Apology and Reparation for Massacres of Civilians
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Make Apology and Reparation for Massacres of Civilians
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The south Korean joint fact-finding group for unearthing remains of civilians killed during the Korean war which consists of the Institute for National Studies and other organizations held a press conference in Seoul on Dec. 2 at which it demanded the "government" make an apology and reparation for the massacres of civilians, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 On February 24 the fact-finding group started the work for unearthing remains of civilians mercilessly killed during the June 25 Korean war. In this course remains and relics of civilians were discovered in Jinju, South Kyongsang Province in March.
					
					 Bereaved families and members of civic and public organizations demanded an apology and reparation for the massacres of civilians committed by the Syngman Rhee regime in the past but the present authorities have not taken any measure.
					
					 Disclosing this fact, the joint fact-finding group said it would conduct the work for unearthing remains in the future, too, and probe the truth about the mass killings of civilians.
					
					 It also demanded the "government" opt for probing the truth at an early date, make an apology to the bereaved families and institute a law to make reparation.

articles.title: S. Korean Ruling Forces' Power-backed Scandal Exposed
articles.content:
S. Korean Ruling Forces' Power-backed Scandal Exposed
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A power-backed scandal in which a close associate of the puppet chief executive of south Korea was involved has been recently disclosed to  stun the political camp, according to KBS, MBC and CBS of south Korea.
					 The criminal is Jong Yun Hoe who was the chief of staff of the president of the "Mirae Federation of south Korea" after its emergence while acting an aide to the present chief executive from long ago. He disappeared from the political circle after Park Geun Hye took office as representative of the "Grand National Party" in 2004.
					
					 But there were rumors that he was behind the decision on personnel affairs as he remained a man shrouded in mist. Shortly ago, his true colors were laid bare when a document on his tendency worked out at the room of chief secretary for public office discipline was opened to public through media.
					
					 According to it, he and other close associates of the chief executive and bureaucrats of Chongwadae discussed the resignation of the chief of staff of Chongwadae and were locked in a scramble for power.
					
					 Upset by this, the Chongwadae side is busy censuring the media persons who reported about the above-said story while the gentries of the "Saenuri Party" are crying out for leaving the probe into the truth to the prosecution.
					
					 The chief executive is working hard to make the investigation focus on looking into the course of leakage of the document, not its contents, terming the case "a breach of national discipline".
					
					 The Democratic Alliance for New Politics, an opposition party, warned that the "Saenuri Party's" act of patronizing Chongwadae would only increase doubts and trigger off the most serious crisis. It is also demanding the "Saenuri Party" opt for probing the truth while asserting that the prosecution's investigation is not enough to probe the truth.
					
					 Scandals have already been expected under the rule of the puppet forces which regard power as an essential means for seeking individual luxury, and they will inevitably precipitate the ruin of the ruling quarters.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Koreans in Far Eastern Region, Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Koreans in Far Eastern Region, Russia
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A memorial committee was formed by the United Confederation of Koreans in the Far Eastern Region, Russia on Nov. 25 on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Ri Ku Yul, chairman of the confederation, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political events such as an event of laying a floral basket before the portrait of Kim Jong Il, film show and remembrance meeting for praising his noble revolutionary career and feats on that occasion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Zimbabwe
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Zimbabwe
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A Zimbabwean committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was formed on November 28.
					 The director of the International Relations Department of the Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front was elected advisor to the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to positively introduce the sacred revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il and organize political and cultural events including a seminar and a film show in the period between November 28 and December 17.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered Abroad
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Film shows took place at the Iranian Diamond Company and two Indonesian companies in the period between November 18 and 27 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Films shown included Korean films "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and "The Monument to Party Founding".
					
					 The director of the Iranian company said the film helped him know well about the tremendous mental power of the Korean people advancing, defying the moves of the U.S. and its followers to isolate the DPRK.
					
					 He highly praised Kim Jong Il as a distinguished politician and great master of leadership as he turned the DPRK into a political and ideological power, a satellite manufacturing and launching state and a nuclear weapons state with his unique Songun politics.
					
					 The director of an Indonesian company noted that all the service personnel and people in the DPRK are united firmly around the Workers' Party of Korea and have reliably defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country under the leadership of the party.
					
					 The director of another Indonesian company stressed that the validity and vitality of the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il have been more clearly proved as the days go by.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting took place in Brazil, round-table talks in Angola, photo exhibition and film show in Mongolia and film shows in Iran and Indonesia during the period from Nov. 25 to 29 to commemorate the third anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's demise. 
					 On display at the venue of the photo exhibition were photos dealing with his noble revolutionary career and immortal exploits. 
					
					 "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and other Korean films were shown in the film shows. 
					
					 Lawmakers of the Rio Grande Do Sul State Council of Brazil praised Kim Jong Il's life of patriotic dedication, saying that he defended socialism and laid strong political, economic and military foundation for the prosperity of the DPR of Korea. 
					
					 A general officer of the Security Bureau of the Presidential Office of Angola said the DPRK is a country that produces and launches satellites and a nuclear weapons state, voicing the belief that under the wise guidance of the respected HE Kim Jong Un the Korean people will win only victory in their just struggle in the future, too. 
					
					 A member of the Leadership Council of the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development said Kim Jong Il met challenges of the imperialists and firmly defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country by pursuing his Songun politics. 
					
					 The manager in charge of trade and commerce of the SHI Group of Iran and an official of an Indonesian company praised Kim Jong Il for turning the DPRK into a socialist political and military power under the banner of the Juche idea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreigners
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreigners
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia, the External Relations Commission of the People's Party of Cambodia, Kuwait University and the Kuwait Times held meetings for remembering leader Kim Jong Il in the period between Nov. 21 and 27 to commemorate the third anniversary of his demise. 
					 The chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia said:
					
					 The demise of Kim Jong Il is the greatest loss to not only the Korean people but the world progressives. 
					
					 He wisely led the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving nation and achieve national reunification. 
					
					 Under his Songun revolutionary leadership the DPRK has turned into a nuclear weapons state and achieved big successes in socialist construction.
					
					 The chairman of the External Relations Commission of the People's Party of Cambodia said:
					
					 The great HE Generalissimo Kim Jong Il wisely led the Korean people and turned the DPR of Korea into a prosperous country. 
					
					 His great exploits are being successfully carried forward by HE Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 I wish the respected HE Kim Jong Un bigger success in his noble work. 
					
					 The rector of College of Social Sciences of Kuwait University said:
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il was the great statesman and philosopher. 
					
					 It is our duty and moral obligation to honor the memory of him in the humblest reverence. 
					
					 The editor-in-chief of Kuwait Times highly praised the Songun leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il before praying for his immortality.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was brought out in booklet by the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia. 
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), says that it is a principled requirement for victoriously advancing the revolutionary cause in Korea to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It indicates tasks to be fulfilled to steadily develop the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place on November 28.

articles.title: Ghanaian Political Party Supports Statement of NDC of DPRK
articles.content:
Ghanaian Political Party Supports Statement of NDC of DPRK
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The National Democratic Congress of Ghana in its statement on Nov. 27 extended full support to the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 It is, indeed, stunning and shameful that the sovereignty of a specified country is seriously encroached upon and an anti-DPRK "human rights resolution" seeking confrontation and distrust, not dialogue and cooperation between countries, was railroaded at the UN.
					
					 The UN should no longer be used as a political lever of the U.S. and other Western countries for adopting a "resolution" against a specified country.
					
					 We are firmly convinced that the heroic Korean people will certainly win a victory in the sacred struggle for firmly defending their dignity.

articles.title: Portavoz de CRC condena a la Federacion de Cristianos del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Portavoz de CRC condena a la Federacion de Cristianos del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En relacion con que en estos dias, la Federacion de Cristianos del Sur de Corea (FCSC) intenta construir otra vez en el pico Aegi una torre de farol mas alta que la removida anteriormente y realizar la "ceremonia de encendida del farol" en una instalacion provisional con motivo del Dia de Navidad de este ano, el portavoz del Consejo de Religiosos de Corea publico el dia 4 la siguiente declaracion:
					Ese plan es una locura imperdonable que concuerda con las tentativas de las autoridades titeres surcoreanas que desean malemplear la sagrada religion en sus fines de confrontacion fratricida. Por eso, constituye intolerable burla a los religiosos de la RPDC y desafio a la opinion publica interna y externa.
					
					Quienes desean la reconciliacion, la unidad, la paz y la seguridad de la nacion deben rechazar categoricamente la demencial campana de enfrentamiento de EE.UU. y la banda titere surcoreana sin ofrecerse en ningun caso como complices.
					
					La FCSC se ha hecho sirviente de la campana psicologica anti-RPDC que trae la confrontacion fratricida y desastre de la guerra, lo cual demuestra que ella es el seudo colectivo religioso que obedece al poder sin tomar en consideracion las relaciones intercoreanas y el destino de la nacion.
					
					La FCSC no debe hacer el acto vergonzoso que participa en la campana intrigante psicologica de la banda titere sino poner fin de inmediato a la construccion de la torre de faro en el pico Aegi y la "ceremonia de encendida del faro por el Dia de Navidad".
					
					Si la FCSC perpetra por fin esta locura a pesar de fuerte oposicion y rechazo de los coreanos del Norte y el Sur de Corea y en ultramar, asumira entera responsabilidad que emane de esta consecuencia.
					
					Todas las entidades religiosas y los religiosos del Sur de Corea deben detener y frustrar la construccion de la torre del faro en el pico Aegi y la "ceremonia de encendida del faro por el Dia de Navidad" que agrava la confrontacion fratricida y trae a la nacion solo las calamidades.

articles.title: Distribuida declaracion de portavoz de MINREX como documento oficial de CS de ONU
articles.content:
Distribuida declaracion de portavoz de MINREX como documento oficial de CS de ONU
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Quedo distribuida el dia 2 como documento oficial A/69/616-S/2014/849 de la Asamblea General y el Consejo de Seguridad, de la ONU, la declaracion fechada 20 de noviembre del portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en relacion con que en el tercer comite del 69o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, Estados Unidos hizo aprobar forzosamente la "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC, instigando a algunos paises de la UE y Japon y recogiendo los votos a favor mediante la coercion y la presion politica y economica.

articles.title: Establecido el Fondo del Verde de Corea
articles.content:
Establecido el Fondo del Verde de Corea
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Quedo establecido en octubre ultimo el Fondo del Verde de Corea (FVC).
					El FVC tiene como mision elevar atencion social y contribuir al desarrollo del verde al prestar a las unidades que desarrollan la energia de verde, renovacion de recursos, alimentos de verde, agricultura organica y otros.
					
					Su fuente financiera consiste en la donacion de los coreanos en ultramar, extranjeros, organos, empresas, entidades y ciudadanos domesticos que aspiran el desarrollo del verde.
					
					No hay distincion en la forma y contenido de donacion, la nacionalidad, la  raza, el criterio  politico y la creencia religiosa.
					
					El FVC da publicidad, a traves de su anuario y pagina Web, el estado de sus labores y realiza de diversa forma la evaluacion y el trato privilegiado a los donadores y las entidades ejemplares, tales como el recorrido y la visita a los lugares famosos de Corea.
					
					Ahora lleva a cabo la labor para inaugurar la pagina Web de Internet y fabricar las publicaciones de propaganda exterior e interior.
					
					El Secretariado del Fondo de Verde de Corea se encarga de la labor del Fondo.
					
					El FVC desea estrechar las relaciones y la cooperacion con las entidades no gubernamentales y los individuos de todos los paises y regiones del mundo.
					
					El organo esta situado en el barrio Kinmaul no.1 del capitalino municipio de Moranbong.
					
					E-mail: pptayang@star-co.net.kp
						Fax: 850-2-381-2100/4410
						Telefono: 850-2-18-111/Ext:381-8625.

articles.title: Proteccion de discapacitados en Corea
articles.content:
Proteccion de discapacitados en Corea
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Este ano, en virtud de la politica constante del Estado, se lograron exitos en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en las labores para defender los intereses de los discapacitados y facilitarles el confort.
					Asi dijo el vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Federacion de Proteccion a Discapacitados de Corea, Kim Mun Chol, en el acto por el Dia Internacional de Discapacitados de 2014 y continuo:
					
					Segun la resolucion del Consejo de Ministros aprobada en marzo pasado, quedo enmendado y complementado el reglamento de ejecucion de la ley de proteccion de discapacitados.
					
					De esa manera, se hizo posible garantizar los derechos e intereses de la poblacion invalida en todos los sectores de la vida social y darles las condiciones de vida mas estables y favorables.
					
					En junio, con motivo del Dia Nacional de Discapacitados, tuvo lugar el acto conjunto en el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Pyongyang.
					
					Se llevo a cabo la investigacion de lo que demandan los discapacitados en la rehabilitacion, la educacion, la vida cultural, el trabajo y otros sectores de la vida social.
					
					Gracias al sistema de ensenanza obligatoria general de 12 anos, se trazo el proyecto del curso escolar de las escuelas de discapacitados y se fortalecio la educacion profesional para formarlos como personal calificado.
					
					En mayo, se efectuo la ceremonia de apertura del tercer periodo de la Escuela de Formacion de Discapacitados Calificados.
					
					Comenzo este ano la educacion extraescolar conforme a la vocacion y talento de los discapacitados.
					
					Instruidos por los especialistas, ellos aprendieron los instrumentos musicales, la cancion y la danza y participaron hasta en los conciertos ofrecidos en el extranjero.
					
					Se impartio el cursillo de lenguaje corporal internacional para los sordomudos que ya pueden realizar el intercambio con el extranjero.
					
					Entre tanto, los deportistas discapacitados de nuestro pais ocuparon tercer lugar en la natacion y la competencia individual de tenis de mesa de la Competencia Asiatica de Discapacitados 2014 y los futbolistas sordomudos van a participar en el partido de amistad de futbol programado en Australia.
					
					Se activan tambien el intercambio y cooperacion internacionales.
